alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 13 at 4:53PM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely Saturday across Portions of the Southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande... .A dry cold front will move through the region during the pre-dawn hours early Saturday. Very strong northwest winds will develop behind the front, with gusts up to 40 mph possible through the day coinciding with minimum RH values in the upper teens in the afternoon. Fuels are drought stressed and cured through this region. Therefore it is likely that critical fire weather conditions will occur. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread very rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
